verses.text: Unless the \+w Lord|strong="H3068"\+w*builds the house, those who build it labour in vain. Unless the \+w Lord|strong="H3068"\+w*guards the city, the watchman wakes in vain.
In vain you rise early, and finish so late, and so eat sorrowâ€™s bread; for he cares for his loved ones in their sleep.
Children are a gift of the \+w Lord|strong="H3068"\+w*, the fruit of the womb, a reward.
Like arrows wielded by warriors, are the children of youth.
Happy the man who has filled his quiver full of them. He will not be ashamed when he speaks with enemies in the gate.
